item.title: PuTTY proxy trick
item.description: Did you know you use an SSH connection as a proxy using PuTTY? I didnâ€™t until today ðŸ™‚ Fire up PuTTY but before you connect navigate to Connectionâ€“>SSHâ€“>Tunnels. Here you can specify a port you want PuTTY to respond to proxy requests. Choose a port that is not in use on your localhost, I will use 8080 in this example. Choose Dynamic on Destination and click Add. In the forwarded ports part of the windows you will now see D8080.
